meanings.definition: Relating to fermions, a type of subatomic particle.
meanings.sent1: The fermionic properties of the electron determine its behavior in an atom.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the fermionic nature of particles to understand their interactions.
meanings.sent3: The fermionic dance of particles in the quantum world is quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of subatomic particles, fermionic characteristics play a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The concept of fermionic particles can be quite complex but is essential in physics.

meanings.sent1: The fermionic nature of the quark makes it distinct from other particles.
meanings.sent2: Objects with fermionic properties follow specific rules in quantum mechanics.
meanings.sent3: The fermionic behavior of the neutrino adds an interesting twist to particle physics.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a fermionic way, always following unique paths of thought.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the fermionic properties of matter is crucial for many scientific discoveries.

meanings.sent1: The fermionic interactions between particles can lead to interesting outcomes.
meanings.sent2: Studying fermionic systems helps us grasp the complexities of the universe.
meanings.sent3: The fermionic nature of the experiment surprised the researchers with its results.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas flowed in a fermionic manner, connecting seemingly unrelated concepts.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the fermionic behavior of matter opens up new possibilities in science.
